<<<<<<< HEAD
Certaine observations concerning the office of the Lord Chancellor composed by the Right Honorable and most learned Thomas, Lord Ellesmere, late Lord Chancellor of England ; whereunto is annexed a perfect table and a methodicall analysis of the whole treatise. Egerton, Thomas, Sir, 1540?-1617.
[8], 120, [6] p. : ill.
Printed for Mathhew VValbanck ... Henry Twyford ... and Iohn Place ..., London : 1651.
Attribution to Lord Ellesmere considered doubtful. Cf. DNB; Holdsworth, W.S. Sources and literature of English law; Watt, R. Bibl. Brit. This item appears at reel 56:9 as Wing B4098 (number cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.), and at reel 66:2 as Wing (CD-ROM, 1996) E539. Reproduction of original in British Library and Huntington Library.
=======

[8], 120, [6] p. : ill.
Printed for Mathhew VValbanck ... Henry Twyford ... and Iohn Place ..., London : 1651.
Attribution to Lord Ellesmere considered doubtful. Cf. DNB; Holdsworth, W.S. Sources and literature of English law; Watt, R. Bibl. Brit.
